definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: Vow to be the earth that nurtures plants and cradles sentient beings.
sentences.chinese: 發願作一方大地，普載衆生，生長萬物。

sentences.english: If there are beings who hear this teaching, they should aspire to be born in that land.
sentences.chinese: 若有衆生，聞是說者，應當發願，生彼國土。

sentences.english: Vow to be a flower bearing fragrance.
sentences.chinese: 發願作一朵鮮花，吐露芬芳，給人清香。

sentences.english: Vow to be the winter sun shedding warmth.
sentences.chinese: 發願作一個冬陽，溫暖大地，成熟萬物。

sentences.english: Like Tara, she took a vow to always be reborn as a woman.
sentences.chinese: 像度母一樣，她發願常轉世爲女身利益衆生。

sentences.english: Make great vows, to benefit all sentient beings.
sentences.chinese: 發願必鬚髮利益衆生的大願。

sentences.english: Vow to be a streetlight showing the way.
sentences.chinese: 發願作一盞路燈，照破黑暗，指引光明。

sentences.english: The buddhas and bodhisattvas have vowed to work towards the accomplishment of selfless aspiration prayers such as these.
sentences.chinese: 諸佛菩薩曾發願要讓如本文的無私願力祈請文能圓成。

sentences.english: Vow to be an artist's brush adding to the world's beauty.
sentences.chinese: 發願作一支畫筆，採繪世界，增添美麗。

definition: (of a deity) to take a material shape/to appear
chance/opportunity/predestined relationship/(Buddhist) principal and secondary causes/chain of cause and effect
tathagata (Buddha's name for himself, having many layers of meaning - Sanskrit: thus gone, having been Brahman, gone to the absolute etc)
gate to enlightment (Buddhism)/Buddhism/way/method/(old) south gate of a palace
founder (of a craft, religious sect etc)
